intro: Acinodendron pauciflorum, commonly known as the few-flowered acinodendron, is a species of flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and small trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a glossy surface. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or undergrowth. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
